parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: The new remarks of the authorization rule. It can be up to 500 characters in length.

parameters.name: Databases
parameters.description: The databases and database accounts that a user associated with the modified rule can manage.

parameters.name: EffectiveEndTime
parameters.description: The end time of the new validity period of the authorization rule. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: seconds.

parameters.name: EffectiveStartTime
parameters.description: The start time of the new validity period of the authorization rule. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: seconds.

parameters.name: HostGroups
parameters.description: The asset groups and asset accounts that a user associated with the modified rule can manage.

parameters.name: Hosts
parameters.description: An array that consists of the host IDs and host account IDs with which the modified authorization rule is associated.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description:
The ID of the bastion host whose authorization rule you want to modify.

> You can call the [DescribeInstances](~~153281~~) operation to query the bastion host ID.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the bastion host to which the authorization rule to modify belongs.

> For more information about the mapping between region IDs and region names, see [Regions and zones](~~40654~~).

parameters.name: RuleId
parameters.description: The ID of the authorization rule to modify.

parameters.name: RuleName
parameters.description: The new name of the authorization rule. The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length and can contain periods (.), underscores (\_), hyphens (-), single quotation marks ('), and spaces. It cannot start with a special character.

parameters.name: UserGroupIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the user groups with which the modified authorization rule is associated.

parameters.name: UserIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the users with whom the modified authorization rule is associated.
